results.title: The Treasure of Sierra Madre
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: John Huston won Academy Awards both as director and writer of this film. Based on B. Traven’s novel, it reveals the effects of greed and the lure of sudden wealth on three penniless prospectors. Humphrey Bogart, as Fred C. Dobbs, gives one of the best performances of his career. We watch him change from a likeable drifter into a man capable of killing his best friend in cold blood.

results.title: On s'est trompe d'histoire d'amour = We Were Mistaken About a Love Story
results.brief_description:
Anne, a switchboard operator, is living with Pierre who works in the same insurance company. One day, the young woman discovers she is pregnant. Anne finds unrealistic to keep the child given their social situation, while Pierre is overjoyed at the thought of becoming a father.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Jean-Louis Bertucelli ; writers, Jean-Louis Bertucelli, Coline Serreau ; photography, Claude Agostini ; music, Catherine Lara.
Cast: Coline Serreau, Francis Perrin, Nicole Dubois, Gerard Cailleau, Jacques Rispal.

results.title: Le Rouge et le Noir (Episode 2) = the Red and the Black
results.brief_description:
Julien Sorel continues his efforts to climb into high society in mid-nineteenth century France.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Danielle Darrieux, Jean Martinelli, Antonella Lualdi, Antoine Balpetre, Jean Mercure, Georges Descrieres.

results.title: Broadway melody of 1938
results.creator_credit: Roy Del Ruth, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Taylor plays Steve Raleigh, a Broadway producer who wants to put on a show called Broadway Melody. Eleanor Powell plays Sally Lee, the girl Steve loves who owns a racehorse which must win the big event to finance the show. Sensational dancing is the highlight of this musical as well as Judy Garland’s very first appearance in an MGM musical performing her first big hit - ‘Dear Mr. Gable (You Made Me Love You)’ - a superb show-stopper.

results.title: Le Rouge et le Noir (Episode 1) = the Red and the Black
results.brief_description:
Julien Sorel, a carpenter’s son, becomes the tutor of Madame de Renal’s children thanks to the intervention of Abbot Chelan. Soon after he becomes Madame de Renal’s lover. Remorsefully, she puts an end to their affair. Julien leaves his employement to become the secretary of the Marquis de la Mole. The Marquis’ daughter, Mathilde falls for Julien and soon wedding preparations are underway.

Credits: Producer, Louis Wipf ; director, Claude Autant-Lara ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost ; photography, Michel Kelber ; music, Rene Cloerec ; art direction, Max Douy.
Cast: Gerard Philipe, Danielle Darrieux, Jean Martinelli, Antonella Lualdi, Antoine Balpetre, Jean Mercure, Georges Descrieres.

results.title: To have and have not
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Lauren Bacall’s sizzling screen debut in “To have and have not” also marked her first role opposite Humphrey Bogart. The film that brought this legendary couple together is an adaptation of the Ernest Hemingway novel, set on the German controlled island of Martinique during World War II. The compelling script by Jules Furthman and William Faulkner captures the drama of the war-torn 40’s and is peppered with witticisms and wisecracks. Supporting players Walter Brennan and Hoagy Carmichael keep the action brisk, but the scenes between sullen Bogie and silky Bacall exude a heat and humour that pervade the entire picture.

results.title: At the circus
results.creator_credit: Edward Buzzell, Mervyn LeRoy and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A shyster lawyer and two incompetents save a circus from bankruptcy while a man-eating gorilla and the combined unmistakable talents of a tattooed lady and a crazy musical conductor move the plot foward at a furious pace. Blending all that is ridiculous and crazy this movie is one of the Marx Bros classics. Cast also includes Eve Arden, Margaret Dumont, Nat Pendleton, Fritz Feld.

results.title: Cadet Rousselle
results.brief_description:
In love with the mayor’s daughter, Cadet-Rousselle is separated from his love by money and by low-born parentage. Thus, he heads to Paris to find fame and fortune and make himself worthy of his sweetheart. En route Cadet-Rousselle gets mixed up with a band of gypsies who plan to help the Royalists topple the new French Republic. Adventure piles upon adventure as Rousselle narrowly escapes death at every turn. With him all the way is the new love of his life, fiery gypsy lass Violetta.

Credits: Producer, Rene Bezard ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writers, Jean Halain, Jean-Paul Lacroix ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Francois Perier, Dany Robin, Bourvil, Christine Carrere, Madeleine Lebeau, Alfred Adam, Jacques Dufilho.

results.title: L'or du Duc = the Duke's Gold
results.brief_description:
Adhemar, Rajah of Kashmir decides to play a nasty trick on his estranged relatives and disinherit them all … except for Ludovic, a vague nephew. Ludovic is a hopeless dreamer and gambler, up to his neck in debts and unpaid tax bills who has to support a wife and ten children. The inheritance arrives in the form of a double-decker bus in which the family promptly moves in order to avoid creditors and gendarmes. For the family, the bus is a wonderful toy which allows them to visit Paris and meet with eccentric characters. The bus also attracts the interest of the Rajah’s former servant, for he alone knows that the double-decker is made of pure gold. This is a charming comedy filled with surrealistic moments and songs.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Kalfon ; director, Jacques Baratier ; writers, jacques Baratier, Eric Ollivier ; photography, Henri Raichi ; music, Michel colombier, Charles Trenet, Robert Rocca ; assistant director, Paul Vecchiali.
Cast: Pierre Brasseur, Jacques Dufilho, Claude Rich, Mony Tarbes, Christian Marin, Jacques Jouanneau, Annie Cordy, Jean Richard, Daniel Emilfork, Daniele Darrieux, Pierre Rep, Noel Roquevert.

results.title: Martin Roumagnac = the Room Upstairs
results.creator_credit: Georges Lacombe and Marc Le Pelletier
results.brief_description:
Martin, a builder in a dusty French provincial town, is hired to construct a house for Blanche, a sophisticated, cosmopolitan newcomer to the district. They have a passionate affair until he discovers that she is a high-class whore, whereupon he kills her and is tried for murder. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide.

Credits: Producer, Marc Le Pelletier ; director, Georges Lacombe ; writers, Georges Lacombe, Pierre Very ; photography, Roger Hubert ; music, Marcel Mirouze ; art director, Georges Wakhevitch.
Cast: Marlene Dietrich, Jean Gabin, Margo Lion, Lucien Nat, Daniel Gelin.
